intro: Stachys dinarica, commonly known as Dinaric betony, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of purple or pink flowers. Its flowers are tubular and bilaterally symmetrical, typical of the mint family. Stachys dinarica is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
